body:
Python's package contains the following two lines:

``` bash
if spec.satisfies('@3:'):
    config_args.append('--without-ensurepip')
```

Which dates back to c65fd3a28968f549eed361d85f715caa4f8f6436. I was able to install python with pip after commenting out this line. Is this flag necessary, or could pip be a variant? Pip may be another package manager, but it's not superfluous.
title: Python 3 does not install pip
